title: Daily Note - 2025-06-30
summary: An incredibly productive day focused on major architectural changes to the Collapsi project, transforming it into a standalone web application. Significant progress was made on AI integration, MCTS improvements, code quality, and AlphaZero implementation, along with setting up Tailscale and a hierarchical note system.
accomplishments: Refactored Collapsi to a standalone web architecture, removing backend dependency and enabling 100% client-side operation.
Created complete JavaScript port of game logic and environment wrapper.
Implemented save/load system using localStorage and JSON.
Extracted MCTS into a standalone module supporting PyTorch and ONNX.
Created ONNX conversion script reducing file size by 60-70%.
Integrated AI opponent into web UI using ONNX runtime.
Fixed MCTS performance issue by preventing instance creation per move.
Cleaned up code by extracting common evaluation logic and creating a centralized state preparation helper.
Made PPO hyperparameters configurable via CLI.
Built a complete AlphaZero-style training system, including policy distillation and temperature-based exploration.
Set up Tailscale for secure networking.
Created hierarchical note template system (Daily → Weekly → Monthly).
Documented all changes comprehensively in README and CLAUDE.md.
insights: Observed a policy-value consistency gap during AlphaZero training: policy loss decreases while value loss remains high, suggesting the policy might be memorizing MCTS patterns without true understanding.
Identified a potential solution to the consistency gap: adding a consistency loss term to enforce V(s) ≈ expected value following the policy.
Recognized major benefits of standalone web architecture: zero server costs, instant deployment, better performance (no network latency), offline capability, and simpler development workflow.
Discovered that MCTS instance creation per move was a major performance bottleneck.
learning: Learned from various code review feedback on RL training patterns.
Watched Mark S. Ball's Collapsi tutorial (and integrated it into the UI).
Discovered that MCTS instantiation per move was a major performance bottleneck, leading to significant optimization.
future_work: Test the AlphaZero training with full 1 million episodes.
Implement the policy-value consistency loss experiment.
Create more sophisticated AI difficulty levels for the web UI.
